node.title: 'To lose a son … is one of the most traumatic losses in life', Alex Braes' father tells inquest
node.alt: A teenage boy with red hair smiling
node.description: The final day of witness evidence at an inquest into the death of a Broken Hill teenager hears testimony from his father, who says he was "his ray of sunshine, his everything".
node.content:
["The final day of witness testimony at an inquest into the death of Broken Hill teenager Alex Braes has heard devastating testimony from his father about the loss of the son he called his \"ray of sunshine\".", "Alex Braes, 18, died on September 22, 2017,\u00a0of a suspected flesh-eating bacteria known as necrotising fasciitis\u00a0after he was turned away three times from Broken Hill Hospital\u2019s emergency department.", "It wasn't until his fourth and final presentation at the hospital\u00a0that vital signs assessments were administered on him and the\u00a0disease was identified.\u00a0", "Holding back tears, John Braes\u00a0delivered a statement about his son\u00a0at the close of today's\u00a0inquest proceedings.", "\"During his short 18 years on Earth, Alex has made us extremely proud,\" Mr Braes said.", "\"Alex brought so much\u00a0joy to those that surrounded him. His kindness, humour and infectious\u00a0laugh\u00a0would bring a smile to anyone's\u00a0face.", "\"To lose a son, a brother, a\u00a0grandson is one of the most tragic and traumatic losses in life.\"", "
A 'problematic' healthcare system
", "Mr Braes said his family had\u00a0been robbed of a full life with Alex, and his son had\u00a0been denied the opportunity\u00a0to find love, get\u00a0married and potentially have children.", "He said their lives would never be the same and that they would\u00a0never forget him.", "Mr Braes said he hoped the inquest would result in changes to the\u00a0\"problematic\"\u00a0healthcare system.", "", "
John Braes says he hopes the findings of the inquest bring changes to\u00a0the healthcare system.(Four Corners)
", "\"While the whole process is of little comfort to us \u2014 and will not\u00a0bring our beautiful boy Alex back \u2014 we hope the findings and the recommendations made bring the necessary\u00a0changes needed\u00a0to fix a problematic healthcare system at Broken Hill Health Service and in New South Wales,\" he said.", "\"Preventing any future deaths\u00a0of a similar nature so that no more families have to experience the loss and traumatic grief that we've had\u00a0to endure over the last four years, and will continue to do so over the rest\u00a0of our lives.\"", "
Push for interstate patient-transfer agreement
", "The difficulty trying to source an intensive care unit (ICU) bed in Adelaide for the critically ill teenager, as well as securing a pilot to fly him to either Adelaide or Sydney, has been\u00a0discussed during this week's proceedings, which have been overseen by Deputy State Coroner Elizabeth Ryan.", "During today's proceedings, the progress of communications between New South Wales and South Australian health\u00a0authorities around establishing a formal patient transfer\u00a0agreement\u00a0came under\u00a0scrutiny.", "Luke Sloane, an acting executive of a branch within\u00a0NSW\u00a0Health's\u00a0Patient Experience and System Performance division, spoke at the inquest today.", "Counsel Assisting the Inquest, Kirsten Edwards, asked him whether the NSW Ministry of Health supported the existence of a formalised, agreed, default mechanism\u00a0around transferring\u00a0time-urgent,\u00a0critically ill patients to the nearest hospital that\u00a0could provide\u00a0definitive care, even if it was in SA.", "\"I think one of the main factors that\u00a0probably play into that is that we have no jurisdiction to mandate\u00a0compliance\u00a0from South Australian Health, with respect\u00a0of default pathways into South Australian Health\u00a0and collaborating facilities within South Australia Health.\"", "
Interstate communication questioned
", "The inquest heard that clinicians\u00a0in both Far West\u00a0NSW\u00a0and in SA\u00a0were supportive of a formal patient-transfer agreement between NSW\u00a0and SA.", "Ms Edwards asked Mr Sloane, who has been with the health ministry since 2019, about how the matter had\u00a0progressed over the years.\u00a0", "", "
The Royal Flying Doctor\u00a0Service currently has one plane permanently based in Broken Hill.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "\"What was done, to your knowledge, between 2017 and 2019 to advance a formalised agreed default mechanism at a Ministry of Heath level?\"\u00a0she asked.", "Mr Sloane said he could not comment about what occurred before his time, aside from some matters regarding Far West\u00a0Local\u00a0Health\u00a0District processes.\u00a0", "Ms Edwards then asked him what had been done since 2019.", "Mr Sloane\u00a0said besides a meeting with SA counterparts\u00a0on September 20 this year, a committee had been established within NSW to discuss the matter.", "\"No,\" Mr Sloane said.", "\"You say that there\u00a0have been meetings. Have there been\u00a0meetings\u00a0prior to the 20th of September, 2021, with people from South Australian Health about this issue?\" Ms Edwards asked.", "Mr Sloane replied: \"We had meetings scheduled and I can't recall exactly\u00a0on what days they were scheduled \u2026 that\u00a0did not proceed\u00a0and so that's why we were very\u00a0positive when the meeting\u00a0for September proceeded with the stakeholders that it did.\"", "\"What\u00a0were the reasons why the meetings didn't proceed?\" Ms Edwards asked.", "The inquest heard that\u00a0another meeting concerning the matter was due to take place\u00a0tomorrow.", "Ms Edwards asked whether anything concrete\u00a0would come from it.", "\"No,\" Mr Soane said.", "\"(To) bring people on board with this idea is the most pivotal thing.", "\"We're\u00a0all on board from a\u00a0NSW\u00a0Health point of\u00a0view, but [we need] to get agreement from SA\u00a0Health\u00a0to progress this.\"\u00a0", "", "
Far West LHD chief executive Umit Agis was excused from giving evidence at the inquest earlier this week.(Supplied: FWLHD)
", "
Health\u00a0district boss excused from inquest
", "The Far West Local Health\u00a0District chief executive, Umit Agis, was originally due to appear before the inquest today but was excused from giving evidence earlier in the week.\u00a0", "He said a life had been \"cut short\" and it was a \"terrible\" situation.", "\"We obviously [will]\u00a0be waiting for the Coroner's recommendations but we know actually we have done quite a large volume of work in the last three years.\"", "He said that included\u00a0better retrieval arrangements, revising ED arrangements\u00a0and introducing a second on-call doctor overnight at Broken\u00a0Hill Hospital.\u00a0", "The inquest will reconvene in Broken\u00a0Hill on April 4, 2022, when\u00a0findings are expected to be delivered.\u00a0"]
